xxl.core.collections.bags
Class EmptyBag

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.bags.AbstractBag
      xxl.core.collections.bags.EmptyBag
All Implemented Interfaces:
Bag
public class EmptyBag
extends AbstractBag

This class provides an empty bag. In other words, this bag is not able to contain an element. Therefore, every method that inserts elements into the bag does nothing. This class is useful when you have to return a bag of some kind, but do not have any elements the bag points to.

Example usage (1). 

     // create a new empty bag

     EmptyBag bag = EmptyBag.DEFAULT_INSTANCE;

     // println the number of elements contained by the bag

     System.out.println(bag.size());

     // create an iteration over 20 random Integers (between 0 and 100)

     Cursor cursor = new DiscreteRandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(100), 20);

     // catch UnsupportedOperationExceptions

     try {

         // insert all elements of the given iterator

         bag.insertAll(cursor);
     }
     catch (UnsupportedOperationException uoe) {
         System.out.println(uoe.getMessage());
     }

     // println the number of elements contained by the bag

     System.out.println(bag.size());

     // close the open bag and cursor after use

     bag.close();
     cursor.close();

See Also:
Cursor, EmptyCursor, Function

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function<Object,EmptyBag> FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new EmptyBag (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Bag). It may be invoked with a parameter list(for further details see Function) of objects, an iterator or without any parameters. The factory method always returns a default instance of this class.

See Also:
Function

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final EmptyBag DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of EmptyBag. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of EmptyBag.

Constructor Detail

EmptyBag

public EmptyBag(boolean throwExceptions)
Constructs a new empty bag that is not able to contain any elements.

Parameters:
throwExceptions - Determining if exceptions are thrown when inserting elements. Possible values: NO_EXCEPTIONS, THROW_EXCEPTIONS.

EmptyBag

public EmptyBag()
Constructs a new empty bag that is not able to contain any elements. Exceptions are thrown if elements are inserted.

Method Detail

cursor

public Cursor cursor()
Returns a cursor to iterate over the elements in this bag without any predefined sequence. The cursor is specifying a view on the elements of this bag so that closing the cursor takes no effect on the bag (e.g., not closing the bag). The behavior of the cursor is unspecified if this bag is modified while the cursor is in progress in any way other than by calling the methods of the cursor.
This implementation always returns an EmptyCursor because the bag is empty.

Specified by:
cursor in interface Bag
Specified by:
cursor in class AbstractBag
Returns:
a cursor to iterate over the elements in this bag without any predefined sequence.

insert

public void insert(Object object)
            throws UnsupportedOperationException
Adds the specified element to this bag. This method does not perform any kind of duplicate detection.
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
insert in interface Bag
Specified by:
insert in class AbstractBag
Parameters:
object - element to be added to this bag.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - when an object should be inserted into this bag.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of elements in this bag (its cardinality). If this bag contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, Integer.MAX_VALUE is returned.
This implementation always returns 0 because the bag is empty.

Specified by:
size in interface Bag
Specified by:
size in class AbstractBag
Returns:
the number of elements in this bag (its cardinality).

query

public Cursor query(Predicate predicate)
Returns a cursor to iterate over all elements in this bag for which the given predicate returns true. This method is very similar to the cursor method except that its result is determined by a predicate. Like the cursor returned by the cursor method, this cursor's behavior is unspecified if this bag is modified while the cursor is in progress in any way other than by calling the methods of the cursor.
This implementation always returns an EmptyCursor because the bag is empty.

Specified by:
query in interface Bag
Overrides:
query in class AbstractBag
Parameters:
predicate - a predicate that determines whether an element of this bag should be returned or not.
Returns:
a cursor to iterate over all elements in this bag for which the given predicate returns true.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use an EmptyBag. It can also be used to test the functionality of an EmptyBag.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
